intro: Pinalia reticosa, commonly known as the net-veined pinyon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive net-like venation pattern. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female inflorescences, and it produces small, round berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Pinalia reticosa is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to cold, arid environments.
